tweets.text:
Pork in America is being fed drugs so toxic they‚Äôre even illegal in China

‚ÄúThere's this drug Ractopamine that's banned or restricted in 160 countries, but guess where it's legal? The good old USA‚Äù

Over 80% of pigs eat this drug in America

‚ÄúBig food companies found out that if they feed it to pigs, they grow bigger, fatter, faster. Now, they put it in the feed and over 80% of the pigs in America eat this drug. 

The problem is there's been over a quarter of a million adverse effects reported in the pigs that eat this drug. 

In over half the cases, the pigs were sickened or killed. And many of these pigs develop a side effect called downers where they become so fat that they're unable to stand up and walk. 

So in China, feeding ractopamine to pigs is banned, in Russia it's banned, and in the European Union it's banned. But here in America, it's breakfast, lunch, and dinner.‚Äù

‚ÄòRactopamine is banned in China for use in pork production. China prohibits its use in livestock due to concerns about health risks and has strict regulations against ractopamine residues in imported pork. This has led to trade restrictions on U.S. pork, as some American producers use the additive.‚Äô

BREAKING: India Ditches China, Boosts U.S. Imports in Major Trade Win for Trump

In another victory for President Trump‚Äôs America First agenda, India has announced it will ramp up imports from the United States, sidelining communist China in a bold move to strengthen ties with the world‚Äôs greatest economy. 

This shift, comes as India recognizes the unmatched quality and innovation of American goods, from energy to machinery, over China‚Äôs cheap knockoffs. 

Trump‚Äôs tariff strategy, slapping a 27% levy on Indian imports, clf early forced New Delhi‚Äôs hand, proving his deal making genius is reshaping global trade to put America back on top. 

Indian officials, eager to avoid economic fallout, are now prioritizing U.S. partnerships, a clear sign that Trump‚Äôs policies are draining the swamp of globalist trade imbalances. 

This move not only boosts American workers and manufacturers but also weakens China‚Äôs stranglehold on world markets, fulfilling MAGA promises to bring jobs home.

NEW: According to the IMF's 2024 World Economic Outlook data released yesterday and BEA data, California‚Äôs nominal GDP reached $4.1 trillion, surpassing Japan‚Äôs $4.02 trillion, and placing California as the 4th largest economy ‚Äî behind only the United States, China, and Germany.

Not only did it grow to be the 4th largest, California‚Äôs economy grew at a faster rate than the world‚Äôs top three economies in 2024: California's growth rate of 6% outpaced the U.S. (5.3%), China (2.6%) and Germany (2.9%).

However, that success is now being threatened by the reckless tariff policies of the current federal administration.

That's why @CAGovernor Newsom filed a lawsuit that seeks to end President Trump‚Äôs tariff chaos, which has wreaked havoc on the economy, destabilized the stock and bond markets, caused hundreds of billions of dollars in losses, and inflicted higher costs for consumers and businesses. 

These harms will only continue to grow, as President Trump‚Äôs tariffs are projected to shrink the U.S. economy by $100 billion annually.
